Belgium: Council of Luxembourg becomes a "sovereign" court: its legal decisions can no longer be appealed to the Great Council of Mechelen.
Colombia:
Juan de Torrezar Díaz Pimienta is Viceroy of New Granada
Antonio Caballero y Góngora is Viceroy of New Granada
Ireland: After agitation by the Irish Volunteers, the Parliament of Great Britain passes a number of reforms—including the implicit repeal of Poynings' Law—collectively referred to as the Constitution of 1782.
Sweden: Sweden purchases Caribbean island of Saint Barthélemy from France
Taiwan:
Chiayi and Changhua prefectures go to war over gambling debts and more than 400 villages are destroyed
Non-aboriginals in Taiwan number 912,000
Tonga: Tuʻihalafatai renounced power and moved to Fiji.
